column4: i am novice in ubuntu so... when i try to install something in terminal it asks for root user password... what to do?
try to give him your user password
how do you install programs? with sudo?
which provider is it? in which country? how you are connected to the internet?
is you cable modem box something like a dhcp router?
can you plug in a network cable in this box?
you have more details about the box?
i see, the box has also a plug in place for network cable. may your provider settings are in this box?
i just read the manual... did you read the manual of the box?
yes... well i have access only to the webpage of providers' dialers downloads... i just need to configure my own dialer so that i will be able to access internet with my own account

are you able to open other websites? the only thing i found in http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-625580.html was to configure your own dialer and downlad http://cables2.netvision.net.il/linux/l2tp-dialer.tar.gz
i don't able to open other websites... i'll check out the first link... the second is of the other provider...
sorry, at this point i cannot support you more...
well i have downloaded the ISP dialer installer, but i have not success in the installation of it, so i am looking for other methods...
so i wish you good luck. i have no idea how to configure this modem or a dialer.... :/
ok, thank for the help anyway
